an1.51:1.2: But it is corrupted by passing corruptions.
an1.51:1.3: An unlearned ordinary person does not truly understand this.
an1.51:1.4: So I say that the unlearned ordinary person has no development of the mind.”
an1.52:1.2: And it is freed from passing corruptions.
an1.52:1.3: A learned noble disciple truly understands this.
an1.52:1.4: So I say that the learned noble disciple has development of the mind.”
an1.53:1.1: “If, mendicants, a mendicant cultivates a mind of love even as long as a finger-snap,
an1.53:1.3: a mendicant who does not lack absorption, who follows the Teacher’s instructions, who responds to advice, and who does not eat the country’s alms in vain.
an1.53:1.4: How much more so those who make much of it!”

an1.56:1.1: “Mendicants, intention shapes all phenomena whatsoever that are unskillful, part of the unskillful, on the side of the unskillful.
an1.56:1.2: Intention is the first of those phenomena to arise, and unskillful phenomena follow right behind.”

an1.58:1.1: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that gives rise to unskillful qualities, or makes skillful qualities decline like negligence.
an1.58:1.2: When you’re negligent, unskillful qualities arise and skillful qualities decline.”
